Package ch.iserver.ace.net

This package contains all the network related interfaces and utility classes.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
DiscoveryNetworkCallback Callback interface for explicit user discovery.
DocumentServer This interface represents the network layer server object for a document.
DocumentServerLogic This interface represents the view of the network layer on the object that implements the logic functionality of a document server.
InvitationPort An InvitationPort is passed from the collaboration layer to the network layer whenever the publisher invites a user.
InvitationProxy The InvitationProxy interface represents an invitation as represented by the network layer.
JoinNetworkCallback Callback interface for join requests on the network layer.
NetworkService The NetworkService provides access to the network layer functionality.
NetworkServiceCallback The NetworkServiceCallback interface is used by the NetworkService for calling the client of itself.
ParticipantConnection A ParticipantConnection provides a logical connection to a participant in an editing session.
ParticipantPort The ParticipantPort is the interface for the network layer to speak to the logical server component in the logic layer of the application.
PortableDocument A PortableDocument is a representation of a document in a portable way.
RemoteDocumentProxy A RemoteDocumentProxy is a network layer object that represents a document shared by another user.
RemoteUserProxy A RemoteUserProxy is a network layer representation of a remote user.
SessionConnection A SessionConnection is a network layer interface abstracting the concept of a connection to the session represented by this object.
SessionConnectionCallback The SessionConnectionCallback interface is used by the network layer to communicate with the logic layer in session scope.
 

Package ch.iserver.ace.net Description

This package contains all the network related interfaces and utility classes. The network layer interfaces allow to switch a particular implementation based on certain technologies quickly, should the need ever arise.
